resources.string: Enter your KeePass database unlocking information

To start using KeePass Share enter the paths to your KeePass database and keyfile, if set. You will also need to save your database password. All information is securely encrypted using two secret keys, one stored in the cloud using your Google Drive storage and another saved locally. Your password is never accessible without having both keys present. A hacker that steals your Google Drive key will be unable to access your password that is saved on-device, and someone that is able to steal your device data will be unable to decrypt your master password without the secret key saved in Google Drive.

Get started with binding KeePass Share to Google Drive by pressing the Connect button. This will initialize your secret key in the cloud if it has not already been setup. You will be prompted to grant access for storing private application data.

KeePass Share is an easy way to make your passwords immediately available no matter which application you are running. Request access to passwords by choosing to Share with KeePass Share from the application you are currently running. A notification or dialog will appear to let you select usernames and passwords and allow exporting them to the clipboard.
